bibl.title: Letter from Lawrence T. Royster to Emilie Lawrence Reed, December 24, 1930

div1.p: Royster informs Emilie Lawrence Reed that he has spoken with President Alderman, of the University of Virginia, about obtaining either a portrait or a bust of Walter Reed.

div1.head: Letter from Lawrence T. Royster to Emilie Lawrence Reed, December 24, 1930
div1.opener:
UNIVERSITY OF VIRGINIA HOSPITAL
UNIVERSITY, VIRGINIA
December 24, 1930
DEPARTMENT OF PEDIATRICS
LAWRENCE T. ROYSTER, M. D.
W. W. WADDELL JR., M. D.
Mrs. Walter Reed,
Burlington Hotel,
Washington, D. C.
My dear Mrs. Reed:
div1.p:
Your very kind Christmas remembrance came, and we appreciate
your thought of us very much. We trust that you and your daughter are
well, and hope you will enjoy the holiday season to the fullest.

On Monday I interviewed President Alderman, and my delay
in doing so was entirely my fault not his. I have been exceedingly
busy since I saw you last.

Dr. Alderman and I talked at some length about the picture of
Major Reed. It was our feeling that if an oil painting, entirely to
the liking of both you and Blossom can not be secured, that rather than
an enlarged photograph of the bust, to which you referred, a bronze
replica of the bust would be most fitting.

I wonder if you would not be good enough to think this matter
over, and let me know how you feel about it and then I will talk to
Dr. Alderman again.
The family joins me in best love to both of you.
div1.closer: Faithfully, L. T. Royster, M. D. LTR/d
